New Records: Alperen Sengun recorded 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 5 assists, tying his career-high with 32 points
Key Match Events: The Rockets built a 17-point lead in the first half and extended it to 61-44 midway through the second quarter
Ja Morant and Jaren Jackson Jr. led the Grizzlies' comeback, cutting the deficit to 115-114 with 2:49 to go
Pre-Game Insights: The Rockets and Grizzlies, with the second and third-most wins in the Western Conference, met in their first of three games this month
The Rockets moved 1.5 games ahead of the Grizzlies in the standings
Post-Match Reflections: Alperen Sengun and Jalen Green provided the key performances for the Rockets
Ja Morant's return from a shoulder injury and Desmond Bane's return from an ankle injury were significant for the Grizzlies
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Grizzlies shot 50 percent but were undone by 20 turnovers which Houston converted into 31 points
The game was highlighted by key defensive plays and clutch performances
Others: The Rockets extended their road winning streak to five
The game included notable returns from injury-induced absences
